item.title: Breaking: US Fed Suer Intervenes US SEC Lawsuit Against Binance And CEO “CZ”
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
In a fresh development in the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) lawsuit against Binance, a third-party “Eeon” seeks to intervene in the case on behalf of customers. The US SEC filed a lawsuit against Binance Global, Binance.US, and CEO Changpeng “CZ” Chao last month, bringing 13 charges including misleading investors and securities law violations.

The post Breaking: US Fed Suer Intervenes US SEC Lawsuit Against Binance And CEO “CZ” appeared first on CoinGape.
item.content:encoded:
In a fresh development in the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) lawsuit against Binance, a third-party “Eeon” seeks to intervene in the case on behalf of customers. item.title: BlackRock’s Spot Bitcoin ETF Application Acknowledged by the SEC
item.dc:creator: Godfrey Benjamin
item.description:
The United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has acknowledged BlackRock’s application for a spot Bitcoin Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF). It is worth noting that the update comes only a day after the SEC acknowledged a similar application from Bitwise, one of the investment firms pursuing the product. BREAKING – The SEC officially acknowledges BlackRock's spot

The post BlackRock’s Spot Bitcoin ETF Application Acknowledged by the SEC appeared first on CoinGape.
item.content:encoded:
